intro: Octanema incana, commonly known as the rough-stemmed octanema, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
